div.div: The School District of Lee CountyPersonal • Passionate • Progressive

div.style: position: absolute; left: 0px; top: 0px; z-index: 100001; background-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); opacity: 0.5; display: none;

div.script: components.addItem("unifiedPublishingAlert");

div.a: With the safety and health of our students, employees, families, and community continuing to be our top priority and based on the recommendation from the Governor of Florida, we have made the decision to continue distance learning in Lee County Schools through the end of the school year. Learn More...

img.alt: Laptop sitting on a table with a glass of water pen and paper

div.h2: Distance Learning for Students and Families
div.p: Learn more about our District Learning for Students and Families.

img.alt: Lunch lady handing out meals to a car with parents

div.h2: Grab and Go Meal Sites (Update April 23)
div.p: Food and Nutrition Services has released updated information pertaining to Grab and Go Meal Sites and more! Learn more at the Grab and Go Meal Pick Up web page.

img.alt: Two sets of hands under a sink faucet washing with soap and water

div.p: A family of viruses that can cause symptoms like the common cold and/or flu virus. Learn more about the Districts action for continued education and community support.

div.style: background-image: url("/UserFiles/Servers/Server_676221/Image/Home/Banner/19-20/April/High School Students walking in hallway 2.png")

img.alt: High School students walking down a hallway

div.p: Important information regarding proposed high school schedule.

Hundreds of Lee County residents are joining their neighbors to “Take the Pledge,” a social media campaign to encourage residents to #stayhomeSWFL and employ best practices to stop the spread of COVID-19.

img.alt: School Lunch Hero Day written in yellow text block letters

div.h3: District to Honor School Lunch Heroes on May 1st
div.p: Between serving thousands of kids through the COVID-19 emergency, preparing healthy food, adhering to nutrition standards, and offering service with a smile, Lee County’s school nutrition professionals have a lot on their plate.
div.a: Read More about District to Honor School Lunch Heroes on May 1st

img.alt: Class of 2020 written in block letters

div.p: There have been many ideas shared with our School Administrators and the District about how to proceed with graduation. We have reviewed all the suggestions, and with safety being our top priority, have compared them with the Centers for Disease Control (CDC) guidelines.
div.a: Read More about Class of 2020 Letter

a.title: Learn more about Advertising with the District, Opens in the same page

iframe.title: An ad for Florida Skin Care

a.title: Learn more about Advertising with the District, Opens in the same page

div.p: Out of high regard for diversity and individuality, we seek to understand unique perspectives. We provide choices, personalize experiences, listen and support and are trustworthy and fair.

We are devoted to our mission of helping students reach their highest personal potentials. We inspire greatness, believe in our students, are enthusiastic about our successes and are bold and resilient.
We are a visionary school system pursuing educational excellence and making a positive impact in our world every day. We listen to new ideas, try new things, recognize trends and adapt quickly.
is to be a World-Class School System
is to ensure that each student achieves his/her highest personal potential

Under Florida law, e-mail addresses are public records. If you do not want your email address released in response to a public records request, do not send electronic mail to this entity. Instead, contact this office by phone or in writing.
